snippet: In August 2011, after receiving over $500 million in federal loan guarantees, Solyndra, a solar panel manufacturer, declared bankruptcy. The company’s collapse has renewed the debate in Washington over the stimulus program and clean energy...
lead_paragraph: In August 2011, after receiving over $500 million in federal loan guarantees, Solyndra, a solar panel manufacturer, declared bankruptcy. The company’s collapse has renewed the debate in Washington over the stimulus program and clean energy subsidies.
